intro: Aster albarracinensis, commonly known as the Albarracín aster, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, mountainous climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
